description: The two countries have longstanding tensions over a disputed territory, Nagorno-Karabakh.
title: Armenia-Azerbaijan: Why did Nagorno-Karabakh spark a conflict?
title_page: Armenia-Azerbaijan: Why did Nagorno-Karabakh spark a conflict? - BBC News
maintext: Fighting came to an end in November when both sides agreed to sign a Russian-brokered peace deal. Under its terms, Azerbaijan holds on to several areas that it gained control of during the conflict and Armenia will withdraw troops from them. Almost 2,000 Russian peacekeepers will monitor the truce.
